{"step_by_step_thinking": "Staphylococcus aureus can cause a variety of diseases, some of which are mediated through toxins. Food poisoning, toxic shock syndrome, and staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome are all caused by toxins produced by Staphylococcus aureus. However, septicemic shock is not caused by a toxin but by the bacteria itself invading and multiplying in the bloodstream.", "answer_choice": "B. Septicemic shock"}
